settings.title: CREATE THE ULTIMATE INHOME EXPERIENCE
settings.description: Are you ready to bring the game of golf home to you? At InHome Golf, our team of experts combine unmatched golf simulator knowledge, extensive design experience and unrivalled enthusiasm for the work we do to bring your luxury home golf simulator to life surrounded by the ultimate entertainment space for golf, gaming, movies and more. We curate the best-in-class golf simulator components and technology and seamlessly integrate them into a beautifully designed aesthetic, creating a functional showpiece that family and friends can enjoy for years to come. Check out some of our work, testimonials and our free design guide below.

settings.title: Lakeview Golf Escape
settings.description: Our client’s home is in scenic cottage country and this gorgeous guest cabin is set slightly back from the waterfront. Our first challenge was the golf simulator room having a unique roof design which the simulator frame needed to fit into. We also custom inset the turf directly into a beautiful hardwood floor that surrounds on three sides and ensured the width of the turf area was narrower than the screen – creating an immersive experience.

settings.title: A Scenic Drive
settings.description: This home golf simulator installation was designed seamlessly as a permanent part of the home’s entertaining area. Situated directly across from their exquisite kitchen/dining area, it was important to create a space open enough to allow guests to come and go, while ensuring critical elements like outside light weren’t a negative factor for visibility on the screen.

settings.title: Shed Getaway
settings.description: Garages and outbuildings are popular locations for home golf simulators, but they can pose many challenges which aren’t immediately apparent. In this case, the client removed an older structure and rebuilt it with the sole purpose of installing a golf simulator – which gave us a beautiful blank canvas for this custom golf simulator shed design.

James is the most knowledgeable guy I’ve met when it comes to golf simulators. When I began planning the construction of my new home, giving him a call to design and install my dream simulator was a no brainer. He worked hands on with me and my builders to ensure a seamless installation that met (exceeded) all of my expectations. If you are thinking of or wanting to build a simulator, there is no one else better suited to help you.

I met James at the Toronto Golf Show and was immediately impressed. His knowledge and solution-based thinking stood out as real differentiators. James visited my garage to assess the space (which I was told by his competitors would NOT work) and came back to me with multiple options, ranging in systems and price points, which was fantastic. He handled the install himself and had me up and running in no time. Thank you James & IHG!

We set out to find a partner who could transform our drive shed into an entertainment hub that could be enjoyed year round. I can say now that we were fortunate to have found the team at InHome Golf. Their knowledge, dedication to delivering premium service and ability to adapt their game plan to meet our needs made it an absolute pleasure to work with them.

settings.heading: What size room do you need for a golf simulator?
settings.description: Room size is the number one question we get asked about golf simulators, and our answer is dependent on a few factors. If the intent is to just install a functional golf simulator, then a room size of 10 ft. tall, 15 ft. wide and 20 ft. deep would suit your needs. In instances where you want to create a holistic experience for friends and family, then 25 ft. long is ideal. If your room doesn’t quite meet the minimum requirements listed above, don’t panic – Give us a call at1-800-557-5859or email atinfo@inhomegolf.com, and we’ll happily take the time to better understand your unique needs before walking you through the options that are right for you, your space and your vision.

settings.heading: How high of a ceiling do I need for a golf simulator?
settings.description: Generally speaking, 9 ft. ceilings are the minimum requirement for a golf simulator, with 10 ft. being considered a more “comfortable’ height. As is the case with any significant home or business investment, consulting with an golf simulator installation professional prior to purchasing your golf simulator is highly recommended. Give us a call at1-800-557-5859or email atinfo@inhomegolf.com, and we’ll happily take the time to better understand your unique needs before walking you through the options that are right for you, your space and your vision.

settings.heading: Where do I mount the projector for my golf simulator?
settings.description: When it comes to mounting, there is, regrettably no rule of thumb or silver bullet answer for where to mount it. Every projector has a unique throw distance (the distance from the tip of the projector’s lens to the screen) which is affected by your impact screen’s size and aspect ratio. Given how critical this is to setup accurately, we recommend consulting with an golf simulator installation professional before purchasing. Give us a call at1-800-557-5859or email atinfo@inhomegolf.com, and we’ll happily take the time to better understand your unique needs before walking you through the options that are right for you, your space and your vision.

settings.heading: How far away from the screen should the strikemat be for a golf simulator?
settings.description: In an ideal world, we like to put the ball 12 feet from the screen. That said, we can work in tigher spaces, and can still design a great simulator, for example with a 10 ft. distance from ball to screen. Give us a call at1-800-557-5859or email atinfo@inhomegolf.com, and we’ll happily take the time to better understand your unique needs before walking you through the options that are right for you, your space and your vision.

settings.heading: Can you use any projector for a golf simulator?
settings.description: No, unfortunately you can not use any projector to for a golf simulator. Office quality projectors or large venue projectors, for example, typically don’t have the appropriate throw distance (the distance from the tip of the projector’s lens to the screen). Additionally, the brighter your room is the more important the measured lumens (brightness) of your proejector matters as well, so be sure to consult an expert in golf simulators before purchasing so that you’re not disapointed in the quality of the results. Give us a call at1-800-557-5859or email atinfo@inhomegolf.com, and we’ll happily take the time to better understand your unique needs before walking you through the options that are right for you, your space and your vision.

settings.heading: GOLF SIMULATORS - AS EASY AS 1-2-3
settings.subtitle: Getting the ball rolling (or in this case, flying) is incredibly simple. InHome Golf’s team of experts is ready to help you design and build your custom home golf simulator when you’re ready. In the meantime, here are easy steps to help you get started:

settings.heading: TRUSTED BY THE BEST IN GOLF
settings.description: We’ve designed and built custom golf simulators and entertainment spaces for some of the biggest, most prestigious and discerning names in the golf industry.

settings.title: GET THE MOST OUT OF YOUR SPACE
settings.description: We can turn your golf simulator into a multi-purpose entertainment hub to delight the most discerning friends and family – even if golf isn’t their activity of choice. From watching movies or gaming on the big screen to playing other sports, we offer a suite of products and creative ideas to enhance the ways to enjoy your golf simulator space.

settings.title: LET US GUIDE YOU
settings.description: We’ve created a free guide to help you through the step-by-step process of bringing your custom home golf simulator to life. Download our golf simulator guide or reach out to the team to start planning your dream golf and entertainment space.
